content_sections.content:
Vue Directives Reference Example Using the v-text directive to overwrite the existing text inside a paragraph.

Old text.

Definition and Usage The v-text directive is used to update the text in an element. When updating text in an element with the v-text directive, any existing text and child elements will be replaced by the new text. Note: If you want to update just a part of a text inside a tag, consider using text interpolation {{ }} instead. Related Pages Vue Tutorial: Text Interpolation Vue Directives Reference ★ +1
